title: Bloom of Faded Years. [A novel.]
author: Downe, Walmer.
snippet: The two young gentlemen sat smoking in the front parlour, gazing listlessly down the wide, beautiful London Road, which met The Walk not far distant.

title: Over-Sea; or, England, France and Scotland as seen by a live American ... With numerous illustrations, etc
author: Morford, Henry.
snippet: My own land, nearly four thousand miles away, was to make itself felt and remembered, even amid the notaole in Old World art and nature. I was descending the hill, past that spot on the Southern side, between the London Road and Waterloo Place, where the noble pile of the Royal High-School now marks the site once occupied by the Kirk of Fieid (or Church in the Fields) in which Queen Mary's worthless husband, Darnley, was blown up and murdered in February, 1567 ;—past the handsome little Burns Monument, a pillared Grecian temple on base, with winged griffins supporting an hour-glass ;—past the Prison of Edinboro', embattled with more than forty turrets, and notably handsome (to those who only see it from the outside .')—when I saw something fluttering up the flagstaff Jo. the Royal Hotel, down Prince's Street, and recognized, for the first time in weeks, the starry flag which had so lately been raised anew over the last strong-hold of rebellion !

title: Bloom of Faded Years. [A novel.]
author: Downe, Walmer.
snippet: Slowly she ascended to the top flat, hut all the doors were closed, and there was no unusual sound or stir on the stair, save that a footman passed by her on the second landing. Myrtle hurried, in order to get a view from their front window, and was just in time to see the coachman turning his horses to the opposite side from where they stood; then in another minute the carriage had disappeared down the spacious London Road.
